features: KEEP YEAST IN CHECK: The Killer boric acid suppositories by Love Wellness help balance pH and maintain healthy yeast levels to support a healthy vaginal flora. Includes 14 suppositories per pack.

HOW IT WORKS: These vaginal suppositories for women are made with a single, fast-working ingredient (boric acid). Perfect for use after being intimate, at the end of your period, or when you're experiencing irritation from pH imbalance. This intimate health must-have is made with ingredients that are kind to skin and safe to use.
CAREFULLY-SELECTED INGREDIENTS: No fragrance, essential oils, and other additives that may be harmful.

HOW TO USE: Perfect for use after being intimate, at the end of your period, or when you’re experiencing irritation from pH imbalance. Do not take orally. With clean hands, insert 1 suppository into the vagina at bedtime daily as needed or for up to 14 days. Expect some discharge overnight (we like to wear a thin pad to protect our undies). You should always insert after you have fully emptied your bladder.

LOVE YOURSELF WELL: At Love Wellness, we create safe and effective wellness products for your gut, brain, and vagina. Discover doctor-developed products that fit your body's needs. How you feel comes first, and we're here to help you feel your absolute best.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Does The Killer dissolve, or do I have to take it out later? The Killer capsule will dissolve over the course of a few hours. No need to take it out or touch it again after it's been inserted. Can I take The Killer by mouth instead of using it vaginally? No — The Killer is a vaginal suppository and is meant to only be inserted into the vagina. Do not insert The Killer into any other part of your body. Can I use The Killer while I'm on my period? We recommend waiting until the end of your period (or almost the end) before beginning to use The Killer. Can I be intimate while using The Killer? We recommend waiting 24-48 hours after using The Killer before being intimate. Can I use The Killer while pregnant or breastfeeding? The Killer is not approved for use if you are pregnant or breastfeeding. Please consult with your doctor to see which products may be most suitable for use while you are pregnant or breastfeeding.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars CURES BV OVERNIGHT
reviews.reviewText: I’ve been buying these for a couple years now and I just wanted to say they absolutely work. I sometimes get bv after my period and just one of these overnight will knock it right out! Keep in mind you’ll be leaky the next day and it will smell a bit like cardboard but be patient. It will go away the day after

reviews.reviewText: Excellent product. And they have great customer service as well

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Prefer these to boric acid
reviews.reviewText: I prefer these to boric acid. Well, i guess they work well together. Do boric acid first. And then few days of this. Help get the PH level back on track if you’re having issues. It’s easy to use and there is not much of a smell

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Very effective but
reviews.reviewText: It’s very effective, but you really get an excessive yellowish discharge which is really disgusting and will need to have a liner pad underneath the underwear.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 30, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars This women’s health nurse gives 5 stars
reviews.reviewText: I have been a women’s health nurse for 16 years. I was a bit nervous to try boric acid. Our providers/doctors always use it as a last option to treat recurrent infections or infections that are difficult to treat. It always seemed like it was pulling out the big guns. However, I was feeling a little out of balance. I had been tested for all possible infections and everything was fine. I added oral probiotic without much improvement. So I did a little research to make sure I was good and informed. I tried this product for two nights in a row. After the first night, my symptoms were 75% resolved. Completely resolved after the second. I did not have any negative side effects. I plan to use one after intercourse just to help maintain ph.Things to know:Boric acid’s biggest side effect is vaginal irritation. It can cause pain, burning, and/or bleeding if the irritation gets bad enough. If this happens, stop using the boric acid ASAP and see you gynecologist. Make sure that they know that you used boric acid so that you can get the best care possible.This product comes in little vaginal caplets. They have a little gel cover that melts within the vagina and releases the medication. The caplets could easily be confused with an oral medication. Please note that this medication is POISON IF SWALLOWED. It should only be used vaginally to avoid harm.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars DID WHAT IT NEEDED TO DO!
reviews.reviewText: I was nervous at first because usually I would just go to the doctor to get medication but THIS?! By far an amazing product it cleaned me out just in 1 day. Now am I going to continue to use it to finish the job? Of course but this is great!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 10, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Works very well but left a smell
reviews.reviewText: It was a strong chemical smell, kind of like burnt rubber. Seems this brand is well known for this. It went away after a day and a shower, no discomfort so I don't think it was a bad reaction.
